benchmark_details.name: Active Retrieval-Augmented Large Vision-Language Model (ARA)
benchmark_details.overview: The ARA framework is designed to mitigate hallucinations in large vision-language models (LVLMs) by using active retrieval mechanisms to provide external knowledge during the generation process. It implements a coarse-to-fine retrieval method to enhance the model's accuracy in responding to visual queries.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To reduce hallucination in LVLMs by integrating external knowledge through active retrieval.
audience: Researchers in AI and machine learning

data.source: Multiple datasets including MSCOCO, A-OKVQA, GQA, VisualGenome
data.annotation: The evaluation metrics include accuracy, precision, recall, and F1 score, specifically focusing on hallucination detection.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated by matching the model outputs against ground truths in the evaluation datasets.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates lower hallucination rates in the model responses.
methodology.validation: Empirical validation performed on multiple benchmarks (POPE, MME, etc.)
